data.description: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout.
Put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it.
Move at a speed faster than a walk.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
At a fast speed; rapidly.
At a slow speed; not quickly.
Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else.
Accompanied by (another person or thing).
Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences, that are to be taken jointly.
Used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
A set of written or printed pages, usually bound with a protective cover.
The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin green or red skin and crisp flesh.
Look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by mentally interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed.
Take (a liquid) into the mouth and swallow.
Not existing before; made, introduced, or discovered recently or now for the first time.
Of considerable size, extent, or intensity.
Moving or capable of moving at high speed.
Moving or operating, or designed to do so, only at a low speed; not quick or fast.
To be alive or have life.
To produce musical tones with the voice.
Perform an action; create something.
Possess, own, or hold something.
